item.title: [317]Skill Menus
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Coelho:

I like tutorials that explain how an RSPS works (the protocol, region system, etc). A tutorial doesn’t have to have any code in it to be good, in my opinion.

I’m a fan of that or the complete opposite. If someone actually wanted to learn something about programming, they could read the code and figure it out. Or, google it and learn a little bit about what something does and its uses along the way.

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Skill Menus
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

zyle1992:

On the topic of tutorials, most of them are either C/P with no explanation, C/P with little explanation, something that a majority of the users will neglect, or are things that can be accomplished with common sense and little knowledge of programming.

Exactly!

Coelho:

I like tutorials that explain how an RSPS works (the protocol, region system, etc). A tutorial doesn’t have to have any code in it to be good, in my opinion.

Well, that’s like basic Java though. But your right, I like that too or a tutorial that explains every piece of code in separate lines, where you have to put it together yourself, instead of posting the whole method/command code, and then explaining it.

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Skill Menus
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:203, topic:256172”]Simple Skill Screen template (Note: You’ll have to add the packets for setting the number of pages yourself, since it changes between revisions)

[code=Java]
import java.util.Arrays;

public final class SkillScreen {
public static class SkillPage {
public static final class Entry {
private final int levelRequirement;
private final int itemId;
private final String description;

        public Entry(final int levelRequirement, final int itemId,
            final String description) throws IllegalArgumentException {
            if (levelRequirement < 1 || levelRequirement > 99) {
                // switch 99 to MAX_LEVEL
                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
                    "levelRequirement must be within [1..99]: "
                        + levelRequirement);
            }
            if (itemId < 0 || itemId >= 7956) {
                // switch 7956 to MAX_ITEM_ID
                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
                    "itemId must be within [0..7956]");
            }
            if (description == null) {
                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
                    "description cannot be null");
            }
            if (description.length() == 0) {
                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
                    "description cannot be empty string");
            }
            this.levelRequirement = levelRequirement;
            this.itemId = itemId;
            this.description = description;
        }

        public int getLevelRequirement() {
            return levelRequirement;
        }

        public int getItemId() {
            return itemId;
        }

        public String getDescription() {
            return description;
        }

        @Override
        public int hashCode() {
            final int prime = 31;
            int result = 1;
            result = prime * result + levelRequirement;
            result = prime * result + itemId;
            result = prime * result
                + ((description == null) ? 0 : description.hashCode());
            return result;
        }

        @Override
        public boolean equals(final Object obj) {
            if (this == obj) {
                return true;
            }
            if (obj == null) {
                return false;
            }
            if (!(obj instanceof Entry)) {
                return false;
            }
            final Entry other = (Entry) obj;
            if (levelRequirement != other.levelRequirement) {
                return false;
            }
            if (itemId != other.itemId) {
                return false;
            }
            if (description == null) {
                if (other.description != null) {
                    return false;
                }
            }
            else {
                if (!description.equals(other.description)) {
                    return false;
                }
            }
            return true;
        }

        @Override
        public String toString() {
            final StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
            builder.append(Entry.class.getName());
            builder.append("[");
            builder.append("levelRequirement=").append(levelRequirement);
            builder.append(", ");
            builder.append("itemId=").append(itemId);
            builder.append(", ");
            builder.append("description=").append("\"").append(description)
                .append("\"");
            builder.append("]");
            return builder.toString();
        }
    }

    private boolean isMembersOnly;
    private final Entry[] entries;

    public SkillPage(final boolean isMembersOnly, final Entry[] entries)
        throws IllegalArgumentException {
        if (entries == null) {
            throw new IllegalArgumentException("entries must not be null");
        }
        if (entries.length == 0) {
            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
                "entries must contain at least one "
                    + Entry.class.getName());
        }
        this.isMembersOnly = isMembersOnly;
        this.entries = entries;// TODO: make defensive copy
    }
    
    public boolean isMembersOnly() {
        return isMembersOnly;
    }

    public Entry[] getEntries() {
        return entries;// TODO: make defensive copy
    }

    @Override
    public int hashCode() {
        final int prime = 31;
        int result = 1;
        result = prime * result + ((isMembersOnly) ? 1 : 0);
        result = prime * result
            + ((entries == null) ? 0 : Arrays.hashCode(entries));
        return result;
    }

    @Override
    public boolean equals(final Object obj) {
        if (this == obj) {
            return true;
        }
        if (obj == null) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!(obj instanceof SkillPage)) {
            return false;
        }
        final SkillPage other = (SkillPage) obj;
        if (isMembersOnly != other.isMembersOnly) {
            return false;
        }
        if (entries == null) {
            if (other.entries != null) {
                return false;
            }
        }
        else {
            if (!Arrays.equals(entries, other.entries)) {
                return false;
            }
        }
        return true;
    }

    @Override
    public String toString() {
        final StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
        builder.append(SkillPage.class.getName());
        builder.append("[");
        builder.append("isMembersOnly=").append(isMembersOnly);
        builder.append(", ");
        builder.append("entries=").append(Arrays.toString(entries));
        builder.append("]");
        return builder.toString();
    }
}

private final String name;
private final SkillPage[] pages;

public SkillScreen(final String name, final SkillPage[] pages)
    throws IllegalArgumentException {
    if (name == null) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException("name must not be null");
    }
    if (name.length() == 0) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException("name cannot be empty string");
    }
    if (pages == null) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException("pages must not be null");
    }
    if (pages.length == 0) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
            "pages must contain at least one " + SkillPage.class.getName());
    }
    this.name = name;
    this.pages = pages;// TODO: make defensive copy
}

public String getName() {
    return name;
}

public SkillPage[] getPages() {
    return pages;// TODO: make defensive copy
}

@Override
public int hashCode() {
    final int prime = 31;
    int result = 1;
    result = prime * result + ((name == null) ? 0 : name.hashCode());
    result = prime * result
        + ((pages == null) ? 0 : Arrays.hashCode(pages));
    return result;
}

@Override
public boolean equals(final Object obj) {
    if (this == obj) {
        return true;
    }
    if (obj == null) {
        return false;
    }
    if (!(obj instanceof SkillScreen)) {
        return false;
    }
    final SkillScreen other = (SkillScreen) obj;
    if (name == null) {
        if (other.name != null) {
            return false;
        }
    }
    else {
        if (!name.equals(other.name)) {
            return false;
        }
    }
    if (pages == null) {
        if (other.pages != null) {
            return false;
        }
    }
    else {
        if (!Arrays.equals(pages, other.pages)) {
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

@Override
public String toString() {
    final StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
    builder.append(SkillScreen.class.getName());
    builder.append("[");
    builder.append("name=").append("\"").append(name).append("\"");
    builder.append(", ");
    builder.append("pages=").append(Arrays.toString(pages));
    builder.append("]");
    return builder.toString();
}

}
[/code][/quote]

Made it a while back. Can certainly be improved.

Read full topic
